pullRequest.title: Issue #1405: Implemented tests for Metadata package controller layer

nodes.bodyText: Do you understand why this change resolves jackson deserialization issue? Looks like some lombok \ jackson incompatibility. Probably we should add comment clarifying why we cannot use @AllArgsConstructor here. Additionally there seems to be no problems with NoArgsConstructor so let's use it as before.
Let's check the contents of the second argument using ArgumentCaptor. This is the only way to be sure that the multipart file was parsed correctly.
It would be helpful to use ArgumentCaptor here as well.
We need to create a new instance of the class here because there are no guaranties on junit tests execution order.
Can we use assertFileResponse method here?

It looks like all all these asserts can be replaced by a single call which accepts MultipartFile rather than captor.
assertRequestFile(captor.getValue(), fileName, fileContentInBytesOrString);
Content type will probably be the same in all the similar cases. Therefore we don't have to pass it as a parameter and just use a default value MediaType.APPLICATION_OCTET_STREAM_VALUE.
Also I believe there was a similar case in this or other test class in the pull request. So it would be nice to use the same  assertRequestFile in both cases.
Probably there is no need for generic type here.

I'm wondering if we can extract MULTIPART_CONTENT_FILE_CONTENT. MULTIPART_CONTENT_FILE_NAME and MULTIPART_CONTENT_FILE_CONTENT fields. Additionally let's replace the content of the file from file.txt to some more distinct string like content of file.txt. Once changed please check that no tests depending on MULTIPART_CONTENT are failing.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -59,12 +59,12 @@
             "multipart/form-data; boundary=--------------------------boundary";
     protected static final String MULTIPART_CONTENT =
             "----------------------------boundary\r\n" +
-                    "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"file\"; filename=\"file.txt\"\r\n" +
-                    "Content-Type:  application/octet-stream\r\n" +
-                    "\r\n" +
-                    "file.txt" +
-                    "\r\n" +
-                    "----------------------------boundary";
+            "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"file\"; filename=\"file.txt\"\r\n" +
+            "Content-Type:  application/octet-stream\r\n" +
+            "\r\n" +
+            "file.txt" +

nodes.bodyText: It doesn't seem like a good idea to hardcode a file name and its content. Let's pass these parameters explicitly.
Please replace the string with MULTIPART_CONTENT_FILE_CONTENT.
Could you please suppress checkstyle warning for this line using SuppressWarnings annotation?
